meanings.sent1: She imputed her success to her hard work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher imputed the mistake to the student's carelessness.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how he imputed his lateness to traffic when we all knew he overslept.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was imputed to a guardian angel watching over her.
meanings.sent5: The detective imputed the crime to the suspect with the red hat.

meanings.definition: Regard (something) as being caused by someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He imputed the noise outside to the neighbor's dog barking.
meanings.sent2: The superstition imputed bad luck to a broken mirror.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how she imputed her lost keys to mischievous fairies.
meanings.sent4: The old legend imputed the changing seasons to a battle between sun and moon.
meanings.sent5: The chef imputed the delicious taste of the dish to a secret ingredient.

meanings.definition: Assign (a value) to something based on a calculation or estimation.
meanings.sent1: The appraiser imputed a high price to the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: The economist imputed a growth rate to the new market trend.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how the child imputed a magical power to his lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: The artist imputed deep meaning to the abstract painting.
meanings.sent5: The scientist imputed significance to the unexpected results of the experiment.
